member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Diagnostics.Exceptions.BusinessOperabilityException
member.summary: Exception raised when a severe error is detected by a business logic, that prevent them to execute normally. This kind of exceptions shows a problem preventing the application of the business logic, if the problem persist after retries then there is requiered the intervention of system administrators.
member.remarks: Such an error can be a database related connection error, or an metadata inconsistency, timeouts at the business-store layers, etc.

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.DistributedServices.EndpointBehaviors.SilverlightFaultBehavior
member.summary: By default, WCF services return fault messages with an HTTP 500 response code. Due to limitations in the browser networking stack, the bodies of these messages are inaccessible within Silverlight, and consequently the fault messages cannot be read by the client. To send faults that will be accessible to a Silverlight client, a WCF service must modify the way it sends its fault messages. The key change needed is for WCF to return fault messages with an HTTP 200 response code instead of the HTTP 500 response code. This change enables Silverlight to read the body of the message and also enables WCF clients of the same service to continue working using their normal fault-handling procedures.

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.DistributedServices.EndpointBehaviors.SilverlightFaultMessageInspector
member.summary: By default, WCF services return fault messages with an HTTP 500 response code. Due to limitations in the browser networking stack, the bodies of these messages are inaccessible within Silverlight, and consequently the fault messages cannot be read by the client. To send faults that will be accessible to a Silverlight client, a WCF service must modify the way it sends its fault messages. The key change needed is for WCF to return fault messages with an HTTP 200 response code instead of the HTTP 500 response code. This change enables Silverlight to read the body of the message and also enables WCF clients of the same service to continue working using their normal fault-handling procedures.

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.IDataContext
member.summary: Contract for context pattern. For more related info see http://martinfowler.com/eaaCatalog/context.html or http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/magazine/dd882510.aspx In this solution, the Unit Of Work is implemented using the out-of-box Entity Framework Context (EF 4.1 DbContext) persistence engine. But in order to comply the PI (Persistence Ignorant) principle in our Domain, we implement this interface/contract. This interface/contract should be complied by any UoW implementation to be used with this Domain.

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.IDataContext.Commit
member.summary: Commit all changes made in a container.
member.remarks: If the entity have fixed properties and any optimistic concurrency problem exists, then an exception is thrown

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.IDataContext.CommitAndRefreshChanges
member.summary: Commit all changes made in a container.
member.remarks: If the entity have fixed properties and any optimistic concurrency problem exists, then 'client changes' are refreshed - Client wins

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.IDataContext.RollbackChanges
member.summary: Rollback tracked changes. See references of context pattern

member.summary: Base class for composite specifications
member.typeparam: Type of entity that check this specification

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.Specification.Specification`1
member.summary:
Represent a Expression Specification
Specification overload operators for create AND,OR or NOT specifications. Additionally overload AND and OR operators with the same sense of ( binary And and binary Or ). C# couldnt overload the AND and OR operators directly since the framework doesnt allow such craziness. But with overloading false and true operators this is posible. For explain this behavior please read http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa691312(VS.71).aspx
member.typeparam: Type of item in the criteria

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.Domain.Specification.ISpecification`1

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ErrorHandler.HandleError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Enables error-related processing and returns a value that indicates whether the dispatcher aborts the session and the instance context in certain cases.
member.returns: true if should not abort the session (if there is one) and instance context if the instance context is not ; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.summary: Enables the creation of a custom that is returned from an exception in the course of a service method.

The SOAP version of the message.
The object that is returned to the client, or service, in the duplex case.

member.summary: Looks up a fault details type and create is by means of a fault mapper () or defaults.
member.param: The method where the error was trap
The collection of faultContracts declared in the given method
The actual error to convert into a fault
member.returns: An object being the detail of a fault that represents the given error.

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ErrorHandlerClientInspector
member.summary: Inspects messages received from the server detecting faults and raising the corresponding original exception produced on server side when possible.

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ErrorHandlerClientInspector.BeforeSendRequest(System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message@,System.ServiceModel.IClientChannel)
member.summary: Enables inspection or modification of a message before a request message is sent to a service.
member.returns: The object that is returned as the argument of the method. This is null if no correlation state is used.The best practice is to make this a to ensure that no two objects are the same.
member.param: The message to be sent to the service.

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ErrorHandlerClientInspector.AfterReceiveReply(System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message@,System.Object)
member.summary: Enables inspection or modification of a message after a reply message is received but prior to passing it back to the client application.
member.param: The message to be transformed into types and handed back to the client application.

member.summary: Restores a fault contract detail found in the given message.
member.returns: An object that represents the fault detail if found, or null otherwise.

member.name: T:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ICallbacksSubscription
member.summary: Generic base contract to normalize the subscription and unsubscription to callbacks in WCF/Web services.
member.remarks: Inherit your service's callback subscription contract from this interface and decorate it with the ServiceContract attribute with your custom callbacks interface. Example: [ServiceContract(CallbackContract = typeof(IMyServiceCallbacks), SessionMode = SessionMode.Required)]

member.summary: Adds the underlying service's callback client to the subscription list.

member.name: M:SmartFran.Seed.NLayer.ServiceModel.ICallbacksSubscription.Unsubscribe
member.summary: Removes the underlying service's callback client from the subscription list.
